text: hey guys I decided to do a draw my life
video so you can get to know me a little
bit more since we're all friends here
my full name is Kristin Sarah Jacobson
but my stage name is Kristin Sarah I was
born in Toronto but grew up in Brampton
Ontario Canada my story starts off like
all others mom and dad meet they do
their thing and then surprise you have a
Kristen that's basically what happened I
had a great childhood filled with lots
of love and lots and lots of fun it
consisted mostly of wearing boy clothes
being covered in dirt yes that is dirt
on my face and riding big wheels I was
quite the tomboy when I was 3 my mom
took me to the pet store where I fell in
love for the first time when I set eyes
on the cutest little poodle I knew he
would be my best friend for the next 17
years I have always been a very creative
person as a young child I spent a lot of
time watching mr. dress-up and painting
drawing creating I even made a backpack
out of line paper and staples to wear to
school in kindergarten I also would take
food from my parents fridge and set up a
grocery store in my room and make my
parents buy back their food I also loved
to build box forts and not just your
typical box sports I'm talking
three-story condos I even built one for
Pluto those two levels and he loved it
he slept in it for quite a while I must
also mention that I turned my room into
a four-star restaurant a carnival where
I set up a lot of games for my family to
come in and pay to play them and also a
dance party I also turned my room into a
art studio and that's where I sold my
work to my my family when I was three I
saved up enough money to buy my own
Cabbage Patch doll which cost like $60
at the time when I was nearly 7 years
old my parents decided to move changing
schools wasn't that bad I made friends
quickly with people that are still my
close group of friends today that same
year I also was hand selected to be part
of what would be my first theatrical
performance
was a bird with a few other girls and I
was the only bird with no lines but did
I ever put on a performance as the other
girl said their lines i flap my wings
like a bird on a mission and from then
on I was hooked from then on every year
I was in a school play up until the end
of high school I was also part of the
school choir in elementary school and
school band and middle school I loved to
perform and I knew from a very young age
set that's what I wanted to do when I
grew up I wanted to entertain people
make them smile and laugh that same year
I also got my first video camera it's
one of those black and white ones from
fisher-price that you had to plug into
the VCR in order to use I would spend
hours
reenacting grease the movie over and
over with my friends I even created my
own new show with my co-host Pluto and
my own radio show where I played Ace of
Base songs and read the Magic School Bus
books when I think back to my childhood
I honestly can't think of a dull day and
I have my parents to thank for that
thank you mom and dad for years I did
baseball basketball football took
swimming our class's wrestling skating
acting classes I even have my black
belts in Taekwondo oh yeah watch out in
grade 10 drama class that's where I met
a boy named CF who quickly became my
best friend then boyfriend and
eventually fiance but let's not get
ahead of ourselves in grade 11 I had one
of my most memorable auditions in my
life when I auditioned for the school
play it consisted of me burying my face
into a bowl of Cheetos and I got the
leading role as a compulsive eating
queen in George F Walker's rumors of our
death that was a hoot in grade 12 I
became friends with a group of girls who
had changed my life these girls were all
exchange students from South America
they were like no other friends I had
had before I spent my weekends dancing
sound cell learning Spanish and going on
the most random adventures and falling
in love one of the exchange students
from Paraguay I named Andrea was living
with SIA the boy from the grade 10 drama
class SIA and his family hosted many
exchange students over the years since I
spent so much
at Seijas house with Andrea and the
other fezzes I spent a lot of time with
SIA too and we quickly became best
friends then his friends became my best
friends and before I knew it my dream of
having this amazing group of friends I
could be my complete self with and have
the most fun with became a reality
this year was incredible when it came
time for the fezzes to go back to their
countries I was so sad
but I was also really thankful to have
had met them and have which is still one
of the best years of my life that summer
I spent most of it hanging out with SIA
and my new group of awesome friends I
also made the decision to go back to
school even though I had graduated to
take part in an exchange program where I
would get to spend four months in
Paraguay and this would be the trip that
turned me into a travel junkie as summer
was quickly coming to an end me SIA and
some friends decided to celebrate the
end of the summer by going camping this
was the camping trip where I finally
pulled SIA into a tent and confess my
love for him a couple of days later he
broke up with his girlfriend and we've
been together ever since I know there's
probably gonna be haters out there but
it ended up for the best you know we're
still together nine years later it was
meant to be six months into our
relationship I left for four months to
live and volunteer in Paraguay South
America Paraguay was the most incredible
experience I lived with to host families
and taught English in three different
schools it was also the first time I
came face to face with extreme poverty
and the first time I left the country
without my parents I came back a changed
person speaking spanish fluently and
wanting to travel more following
Paraguay I went to college where I study
TV and film production this meant that
SIA and I would continue our
long-distance relationship for the next
four years SIA decided that instead of
living on campus he would buy a car so
that he could drive to see me on
weekends during my second year of
college I took part in a crazy national
competition for a $50,000 scholarship I
worked really hard for that scholarship
as in not much of a social
life and many sleepless nights and then
one day I got the phone call that I had
got it
I remember being in complete shock I no
longer had to pay for school and not
only that I would be able to spend the
money I had saved for college on travel
and to top it off the Scholarship
Foundation required that I travel in the
summer doing something in my field I
honestly felt like the luckiest person
in the world and I am so fortunate to
have had this opportunity so I would
work hard at school during the year and
also work a part-time job save money and
in the summer I would use that money to
travel my first trip while in college
and my first trip of SIA was to Peru
where him and I filmed a documentary
which you can watch here it was my first
independent project and such a lovely
experience that really did change my
life I learned the power of giving
something as simple as clean water to
those who didn't have it and it was the
best gift in the world
SIA and I learned that we are awesome
traveling together which is a necessity
for any avid traveler the following year
I spent part of the summer living and
working at a TV studio in Ghana in West
Africa without SIA and the other part
travelling through Italy Sicily and
Tunisia with SIA and also my mom
that same year SIA also went to Israel
on his own I really believe that having
our own independent lives with the
support from one another is what has
kept our relationships so strong over
the years during my last year of college
I went back to Paraguay and Brazil with
SIA and his family to see my friend
Andrea one of the fezzes get married
that same year she and I moved to
Toronto together where we would finally
not have a long-distance relationship
for the first time in our relationship
for the next year and a half I learned a
lot about working in the TV and film
industry I worked at MTV Canada and
freelance for large productions such as
much music Canada's Walk of Fame So You
Think You Can Dance Canada the World
Poker Tour chum FM fan fest and we day
throughout that entire year I also saved
money because I wanted to spend
a year traveling the world when our
lease was finally up Seija move back
home for a bit and I started what would
become a ten month trip around the world
but before I left I started a blog
because I wanted my friends and family
to be able to follow my adventures that
blog is called hopscotch the globe and
little did I know it would become a
popular travel website that would
connect me with people all around the
world and give me wonderful
opportunities on my round-the-world trip
I went from Iceland to England and then
I spent three months in India traveling
alone but also making amazing friends
along the way traveling through India
alone allowed me to really grow a lot as
a person and as a traveler in India I
spent a lot of time living in an ashram
and learning about the world of yoga and
meditation which is incredible I also
went to a Buddhism school in a place
called Dharamsala where the Dalai Lama
lives and actually took a course taught
by the Dalai Lama himself it was so cool
listening to His Holiness teach the
Buddhist philosophy during a 60 hour
train ride by myself from the south of
India to the north I actually went
through my entire life in my head
remembering things I hadn't even thought
about in years and reflecting and
appreciating I also remember having this
moment of realization an epiphany and
out loud I said I need to be acting so I
made a pact with myself that after the
trip I would go home and pursue acting
after just over three months in India I
flew to Thailand where I met up with SIA
and him and I spent the next six months
traveling through Thailand Cambodia
Singapore Malaysia Indonesia India again
in Morocco Turkey in Greece the last two
countries my mom even joined us these
six months really shaped the people we
are today we also tried a lot of new
things like eating insects like giant
grasshoppers and scorpion we got our
scuba diving license have the craziest
New Year celebration at a full moon
party drove motorbikes crashed
motorbikes had a shark encounter almost
got chopped up by a boat propeller flew
in a hot-air balloon
saw Angkor Wat learn how to cook great
meals God asked to be in volume movies
swam in the Ganga got lost in the
markets of Morocco slept overnight in
the middle of the jungle made lifelong
friends and the list continues seriously
the stories I can tell are insane it
would make this video about one week
long about halfway into our trip
together we split up for a few weeks to
have our own solo adventure and when we
came back together in India SIA proposed
to me with a necklace he bought while
hiking Everest and we were in our 4
dollar hostel room using a mount he
proposed using a mouthguard case which
was in a sock to keep the necklace safe
the whole trip was incredible and
throughout the journey I blogged and
made some videos along the way people
from all over the world started finding
my blog and emailing me and telling me
how much I've inspired them it was one
of the best feelings in the world
when I got back home from the trip I
moved back to Toronto and see I moved in
with his parents to save money I knew I
had to be in Toronto if I wanted to
pursue acting it has been about two
years now since that trip and since then
so much has happened that I could make
an entirely other video I conquered my
fear of singing in front of people by
acting in three musicals I now have an
acting agent and have been in music
videos commercials TV pilots and
billboards I partnered with travel and
escape which is the Travel Channel in
Canada to make travel videos and have
been hosted by various tourism boards
and resorts around the world to travel
and make videos I even want a film
festival in Puerto Rico I have turned
hopscotch the globe into a travel vlog
rather than writing adventures I bring
them to life using video I have also
started my youtube journey and although
it's only in the beginning I'm really
excited to be here with you guys and I
really love YouTube and believe it's
where I'm supposed to be now I'm acting
and making YouTube videos engaged to my
best friend have an awesome family and
group of friends and I'm about to take
my career to a whole other level but I
can't tell you the details quite yet I
can tell you that it is a TV show and I
am one of the leading ladies I feel so
blessed to have had all of these amazing
opportunities in life and wonderful
people part of it
although I didn't go into much detail
about the struggle part of it and how
hard I have worked to get this point I
have and still do I work hard every
single day this didn't all come easy to
me I believe 100% that everything I've
done I got to because I know how hard
I've worked and that anyone can do it
too if they work hard doing what they
love find what makes you happy and do
everything in your power to make it the
main part of your life so many people
work jobs that make them miserable why
you spend the majority of your life
working don't waste your time doing
something that doesn't bring you
happiness the purpose in life is to be
happy so do whatever you have to do to
get as much happiness in your life even
if it takes some struggle to get there
let love passion and happiness be your
motivation in your drive I hope you
continue to join me on this amazing
journey and we can continue to inspire
each other and create a positive and
enjoyable environment for each other to
motivate each other and follow our
dreams thanks for watching and don't
forget to subscribe because I put up a
new video every week
